description: Unknown. Compare Dutch snoezelen (“to snooze”) or snusa (“to snore lighly”).

entries.meaning: A brief period of sleep; a nap.
examples: The cat enjoys taking a snooze on a sunny windowsill.

entries.meaning: (informal) The snooze button on an alarm clock.

examples: The whole movie was a snooze.

verbs.description: snooze (third-person singular simple present snoozes, present participle snoozing, simple past and past participle snoozed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To sleep, especially briefly; to nap, doze.
examples: The boss caught him snoozing at his desk.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To pause; to postpone for a short while.
examples: It enables you to dismiss the reminder, dismiss all reminders, open the highlighted item in the Reminder dialog, and snooze the reminder. Snoozing a reminder is similar to hitting the snooze button on an alarm clock […]
